response.overview: Sione makes films you want to kiss for hours.  Re practice: aversion to bad (scripts) with desire for good (impulse).  Marianne Williamson claims to do an hour of meditation before a morning scroll to avoid brain fog. Sione’s meditation is the scroll; the brain fog is worth it. Their wish fulfillment, improvised moviemaking proves film isn’t just healing, but healing can spread via film - a maximalist medium of abundance. When you ditch planning you end up with life (sad that I’m quoting the fucking Beatles) but Sione’s is a life worth living. We assume this compels them to film eeeevvvveeeerrrryyythingg, and by way of IG stories for max exposure. From crispy chicken tenders, to touching the microphone foam in a studio (forbidden!) life is good. Don’t plan.
response.title: Stories
